etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in American Naturalist. From scientific Latin Peridinium, genus name (C. G. Ehrenberg Organisation, Systematik u. geographisches Verhältniss der Infusionsthierchenii. 74/2; from Hellenistic Greek περιδινής whirled round (from ancient Greek περι- + δίνη circular motion, something which rotates or whirls round (of uncertain origin); compare ancient Greek περιδινεῖν to whirl round) + scientific Latin -ium) + -an

definitions: A dinoflagellate of the chiefly marine order Peridinales.
Of, relating to, or designating a peridinian.
